subject: Writing
title: The Godfather: Adapting a Bestseller
description: One-minute skill: The Godfather: Adapting a Bestseller.

hook.text: Mario Puzo had never written a screenplay. Francis Ford Coppola had never made a hit. Together, they wrote perfection.

buildup.text: Paramount hired Puzo to adapt his own novel, but he had no idea how screenwriting worked.

discovery.text: Coppola collaborated with Puzo, cutting 400 pages of novel into a tight, three-hour masterpiece of family drama.

twist.text: The studio wanted a cheap, modern gangster film. Coppola insisted on a period epic â€” and was nearly fired for it.

climax.text: The Godfather won Best Adapted Screenplay and became the template for every crime saga that followed.

punchline.text: Two amateurs wrote cinema's greatest crime script. An offer nobody could refuse.

quiz.question: What challenge did Mario Puzo face when writing The Godfather screenplay?
options: He had never written a screenplay before
He didn't want his novel adapted
He was too busy with other projects
